column1: Length ball, angling across him, pitches outside off and goes further away. Left alone
straigther line now, on the stumps and he gets behind it to play a defensive punch towards extra cover

just past the outside edge. Lewis has fallen to Bhuvi's slower ball both times in the series so far, and his uncertainty shows. Ends up feeling for the ball as it goes across him, gets a faint tickle, bounces before reaching Pant
pushed towards mid-on for a quick single. Shy at the stumps but the fielder was a tad slow to get to it
tight line outside off again, Narine was squared up but had the presence of mind to yank his bat away
excellent line again, nibbling across and just outside off, whistles pas the outside edge
length ball on off, plays to point's left with an angled bat

not quite got hold of it but it'll land safe. wider outside off and he threw his bat at it without any conviction or timing, the ball's going to stick on this pitch. It balloons off the top edge but well over cover
yorker length angling across, Narine is drawn into the drive but beats the bat. Sound there, but that was bat hitting ground

that's skillful bowling, he's been taking them away from the left-handers, but brings this one back in and Narine is caught on the crease. Thuds into pad, defeating his attempted flick. Going down though

smart catch by Saini at mid-on. The batsmen were kept quiet and Narine's gotten impatient, goes for a cross-batted slog to a fuller one outside off, gets only a toe end that loops up. Saini times his dive to his right well to pluck the ball
tight bowling to greet Hetmyer first up, swinging in to him but on the stumps, tucked into the legside.
good length, testing outside off again, punched towards point
back of a length this time, but stump to stump, he moves across and pushes this to mid-off
first convincing shot of the day. A bit too short, he goes on the back foot and swivel-pulls it off his pads to the square leg boundary

round the wicket, but strays on the pads and is flicked away nicely again. Good timing but the soggy outfield means they can get only three, with the ball not going to the boundary. Good, quick running
back over the wicket for Bhuvi, but still on the pads, and tucked to fine leg comfortably
still on the pads, he moves inside the line and flicks to deep square leg

trapped him! but Lewis is going for the review. Lovely bowling by the older Chahar, going away from the left-hander, pitching on off and jagging back in to hit him on the front pad's knee roll. And that's three reds on the review, plumb in front. Lewis goes, takes a review with him. Perhaps he was fooled by the movement off the pitch and thought he had a chance of being saved. But it was just a lovely, lovely ball.
yorker to greet Pollard first up, and he can only dig it out towards gully
beauty yorker again, that moves away after pitching, and Pollard is lucky he didn't get an edge on it
and he gets it to move into the right-hander now, Pollard is caught on the crease but gets his bat down in time to bunt it through midwicket

Chahar is on fire! Given lbw again, Hetmyer is uncertain, but there's no review left. Don't think it would have saved him anyway. Chahar's again got the ball to do a snake-dance to the left-hander, going across to pitch outside off and then taking a sharp left to nip in and hit the pad.
this one is wider outside off on a fuller length and the batsman's happy to let it go
fuller on middle, mis-times his drive to mid-on. No foot movement, he was probably looking to drive it towards mid-off

wham! This is what Pollard can do. Minimal foot movement, just goes through with the shot, his reach allows him to convert a length ball to a fuller one and hit it straight back over the bowler for six
good length, tucked to deep midwicket
fuller, outside off, driven to cover
back of a length, stump to stump, steered towards point
length ball going across him, opens the face to run it to point
yorker length again, on leg stump that time, dug out to mid-on
lovely teasing line outside off and a hard length too. Pollard wisely decides to let it go
sticks to the same line, kissing the fourth stump, Pollard's happy to let it go again.
pulls his length back now, but keeps it in the channel and Pollard's still not offering bat
he's finally gone for it, slightly fuller and he goes across to hoick it to deep midwicket
angled across, and Pooran shoulders arms
a bit short, spinning across, flat-batted to long-on
edge goes past slip and to the boundary. Was playing inside the line, but this one just straightened after pitching on off and took the edge.
spinning into him, tries to flick, takes the pad to fine leg
swing and a miss. Quicker one outside off, holds its line, Pooran goes for the big pull, but doesn't connect
ooh nicely bowled to end. Good loop, slows it up a bit - his natural speed is on the quicker side - and Pollard is drawn forward to defend. Dips and spins, beats bat to hit pad
square driven to deep point
floated up fullish on off, Pollard defends it back with a straight bat
strays in line, too far down leg and that will have to be re-bowled
a bit too short, goes on the back foot to punch to long-on
tossed up and drifting into him, goes back and pushes it to the bowler's right
fuller on the stumps, driven to extra cover
length ball on the stumps, hint of turn away, punched to cover
tossed up invitingly and Pollard takes a step down, extends his arms and just deposits it straight over the bowler and over the boundary too
he compensates by going too short, and Pollard slaps it straight but the mid-on fields
good length, Pollard was caught on teh crease, ends up jabbing it to point
not timed but carries over long-off. On a bigger ground, that might have been out. He sort of flicked it over long-off, tossed up outside off to him, but doesn't time it well. Still gets maximum
quicker one, flicked to midwicket
smoked. That's in his slot, and Pollard just needs to swing his arms freely, sending it away over long-on
quicker one and he tucks it to fine leg
sharp turn, but pitches on leg and spins further down to be a wide
turn again, this time on a length and on middle and off, flicked off his pads to deep square
tossed up outside off, he gets a big stride out to drive to the man on the cover boundary
nicely dipping onto Pollard who wasn't forward enough but manages to bunt it into the legside
quicker and shorter, punched from the crease to long-on
tossed up but keeping it well outside off, driven firmly but Rahul at extra cover fields
full toss that time but still very wide of off. He has a thrash at it but again finds Rahul
Krunal is going to keep it well wide of off. Pollard comes down the track that time and beats Rahul inside the circle, driving powerfully to the man at deep cover
keeps it very wide to Pooran too, who is happy to let it go
slows it up a bit and still wide of off. Pooran expecting that moves across but can only tentatively push it back without timing
gets hold of it this time!. Krunal had tied down Pooran in the last game so he's had a look at him. This time he's in position early and launches this high and handsome over cover
quicker one, cramping him up, moves back and across to punch to long-on
reverse sweep, nails it well but straight to Krunal at point
strays down leg again, trying to cramp him for room and bowl quicker. Misses his line
that's a hit-me ball and Pollard obliges. In his arc, goes down on one knee and slog sweeps it, one bounce inot the square leg boundary
Sundar bowls it quicker again and this time gets it on the right length and line, Pollard bunts to mid-on
length ball spinning into him again, clipped fine
a bit too short, Pooran wanted to send that out of the stadium, rocked back for a mighty pull but only edges it onto thigh pad
keep sit well wide of off but this time it's just beyond the tramline so it'll be a wide
fuller, struck powerfully for a loft down the ground but the soggy outfield gives the fielder time to run around and field
mixes it up by bowling into Pollard instead of wide of him, and the batsman pushes it to long-on
fuller, flicked away
flatter and into the legs, clipped to long-on
low full toss, moves across and heaves it to a wide long-on

bowling change works!. Angling across on a length and Pooran wanted to run it down to third man, only gets a thick edge. It's dying slightly on Pant who does well to tumble forward and grab it with both gloves.
nice back of length ball first up, moving away from off stump, opens him up a bit but he manages to squirt it to third man
short ball outside off, good tactic to Pollard probably, but he's equal to it, gets in position and keeps his pull down to deep square
sharp bouncer and Powell is caught in a tangle. Too quick onto him and takes the top edge before he's in position to pull, but lands safely towards leg gully

full toss, fooled Pollard, who was late on it. Quicker yorker gone a bit wrong perhaps, but i'ts struck him on the pads. And Kohli has opted for the review. This was how Pollard fell in the second T20I. This one swung a bit though and it's going down leg. So Pollard's safe.
length ball, nipping in a bit, trickled to the bowler's right off the pad
fifty brought up in style. Krunal was trying to cramp him for room, but he just has so much power, flick-punches this all the way over long-on.
slapped powerfully to long-on
fuller, driven to long-off
that one's outta here! Do you get 12 for those? Fuller ball in the slot, and he takes a step forward and swings this waaaaay over the bowler's head. It hits the roof in fact.
flatter, comes forward and pushes this to cover
heavy ball, aimed at his body, and he pulls this off his chest past midwicket for four
length ball, on middle stump. Flicked off his waist to the leg side for a quick single
tries to heave this over square leg, but can't get the connection. Inside-edged onto his body
middle stump gone! Deceived by the slower ball. Full, but without much pace, and Pollard is through his drive too early. Ball goes through his defense... and that wicket is all Navdeep Saini
low full toss on middle. Driven to long on for a walking single
back of a length, outside off stump, and cut along the ground to third man. Wayward throw from the deep makes Powell search for an extra run via the overthrows, but his partner does not respond
ball stopped after landing on off. Driven, just past extra cover
worked to square leg off his pads. They walk across for one
full, on off and turning away. Tapped back to the bowler
full, on middle, and driven past the bowler to long off on this occasion
fast, but full toss outside off stump. Slapped over the infield, but there's protection at deep extra cover
length ball outside off, and tapped off the back foot to cover
has the elevation, and the distance! Length, on middle, and he rocks deep into his crease to pull into orbit
toe-ended to long on! Another short ball, that he tries to pull, but doesn't have the required connection. Down the fielder's throat
full, just outside off and turning away. Mistimes the cut to point
full, ripper outside off and turning away. Allen tries to slog through the covers but misses the shot
length ball, on middle, and goes straight through. He flat-bats a shot down to long on this time
length ball, on leg stump, and flicked off his pads to short fine leg. They scamper across for one
full, just outside off, and he tries to elevate this over long off. Misses the shot though
back of a length outside off, and the attempted pull is under-edged towards the keeper
full toss wide outside off, and he drills a drive, but goes straight to the fielder
full, on off stump, and the attempted straight drive is mistimed to Pandey at long off
length ball, outside off, and he flat-bats a shot to long on for a single
goes over wide long on! Full, just outside off, and enough behind Allen's slog to clear the boundary line
slower ball, back of a length outside off, and angling in. Tries to pull but the ball goes under it
checked, but checked well! Juicy full toss near his waist, and he opens his front leg before hammering a shot over midwicket
full, on leg stump, and the attempted swipe takes an inside-edge to short third man
length ball, just outside off, and cut square to deep point
full, on middle, and he swings this off his toes behind square leg for a six!
yorker, just outside off, and dug down to long on. They scamper back for two and West Indies finish on 146 for 6!
yorker first up, tailing in a bit, patted back to the bowler
length ball, stumps to stump, clipped to midwicket
lovely shot. It was not all that full, but he took a step forward, picked it up from outside off and swung through to send it soaring over long-off
big appeal but not given. Inside edge? Swinging into him, and Rahul has got a bit of a tickle on the attempted flick onto pad
fuller, drives with the full face of the bat to extra cover
length ball on leg stump, tucked to square leg
short ball outside off, but doesn't rise too much, slapped from chest high through cover
length ball into him, clipped to midwicket
expansive swing of the bat to this one outside off, but no feet movement. Inside edge trickles past the stumps towards short fine leg
fuller ball, stump to stump, Dhawan checks his drive and ends up timing it well enough to go very straight
short ball again, but is'nt going above ribs. Dhawan pulls but doesn't time it well, goes to midwicket

he'll be filthy with himself, will Dhawan. Short ball on leg stump, not rising too high again, Dhawan thinks he's just helping it along its way to the fine leg boundary with an almost casual pull, but he hits it straight to short fine leg.
fuller outside off, pushed to mid-off
good length, very tight line on off stump, steers it to point
back of a length and on the fourth stump channel, punched to cover
back of a length again, but on leg stump this time, Kohli shuffles across and tucks it to fine leg off his lower ribcage
too short and down leg, Rahul gets inside the line and pulls it fine, beats short fine leg. He just had to get a little bit of bat on it, and he did. Poor ball
disdainfully pulled, but the timing wasn't perfect, and midwicket was able to get a hand to it and slow it down, for the man in the deep to clean up
back of a length outside off, defended off the back foot to the bowler's left
back of a length outside off, he stays on the back foot and punches pleasingly through cover. Crisp shot
backing away to slash it over point, but Oshane keeps it on a back of length outside off and the batsman can't connect

just eludes Cottrell at the third man boundary! Close to his body but Rahul goes for the uppish cut anyway, and gets good meat on it, but it flies in the air. Cottrell's running to his left and tries to leap to catch it, but it eludes him
bouncer, tries the upper cut but doesn't connect
yorker on the stumps, moves across a touch to drive to mid-on off his toes
too wide and he goes for the slash but doesn't get hold of it and can't beat point
tossed up, full toss outside off, driven forcefully through extra cover but without timing
tossed up again, but dips on Rahul, who was giving himself room, he slices it over cover
flatter and straighter, punched to cover

cleverly done by Allen. He saw Rahul dancing down the track and pushed it through flatter and quicker, got it to sneak through between bat and body, and it was a simple stumping for the keeper. Rahul will not want to watch that replay. Was looking in good touch but he's given it away. Replays show that he was out caught too, the ball took a slight inside-edge
length ball, outside off, and the attempted cut takes an edge to point
length ball, on middle, and mistimed to the leg side
full and wide outside off, and driven away from his body to extra cover
back of a length, outside off, and he rides the bounce before punching in front of square on the off side
length ball, on middle stump. Tapped to cover
short, wide enough, and cut over short third man for a boundary
full, on off stump. Driven straight back to the bowler
length ball, on middle. Defended off the front foot to the leg side
full outside off, and driven away from his body to cover
full, on off, and flicked off his toes to deep midwicket for a single
another ball driven past cover to the sweeper-fielder on the off side
full, on leg stump, and clipped off his pads to deep backward square
hammered! Length ball outside off, and he slices a cut late to beat both fielders on the off side
full outside off, and he skips down the ground. Drives to deep extra cover
length ball, on middle, and nudged off his pads to the leg side
guided to deep point for a couple more. Length ball, played off the back foot
length ball, wide outside off, and he slices a cut late, along the ground for four
back of a length, on leg stump. He swipes around his pads to deep square leg
full, on middle, and he whips this off his pads to deep midwicket
length ball, outside off, and he walks down the ground before mistimes a shot down to long off
defended to the off side with soft hands for a single
length ball, on middle, and swiped once again off his pads to the leg side
angling into his body, and Kohli backs away before mis-hitting to long on
length ball, on middle. He walks down the wicket before flicking to deep midwicket
length ball, wide outside off, and Kohli drops his knees before punching to mid-off
length ball, just outside off and skidding through. Pant tried to defend, but the ball whizzed past his outside edge
length ball, on middle, and turning slightly away. Defended carefully with soft hands
that was played so late! Length ball on middle, and Kohli makes room before guiding it past short third man for a couple
length ball, wide outside off, and he hits this leg-side flat-batted shot straight to the infielder
length ball outside off, and turning inwards. Looks to cut, but mistimes to cover point
full, on middle, and turning away. Fended gently
short, wide outside off, and cut hard to point
shottttttt! Even the WI fans are admiring this. Full, just outside off, and he leans forward to crunch a supreme drive through the off side
length ball, on off, and flicked to the leg side for a single
back of a length, outside leg stump, and he walks down the wicket to pull. Finds deep backward square
full, just outside off, and the cover drive takes an inside-edge to the leg side
length ball, just outside off, and flat-batted down the ground to long
length ball, outside off, and he crunches a cut in front of square. Hetmyer's dive near the boundary saves the four
length ball outside off, and he is beaten by the skiddy delivery. Misses the cut
length ball, on off, and cut square to deep point
leading edge over the non-striker! Tries to nudge it towards the leg side, but it takes the edge of the bat. If only there was a short mid-on....
full, on off, and turning away. Played with the spin to short cover
fullish, on off, and he walks across the stumps before flicking it off his pads to deep midwicket. Fifty stand
attempted yorker, outside off, and he tries to guide it fine. Ball goes under his bat to the keeper
length ball, on off and angling away. He drags a pull in front of square to long on
length ball outside off, and he drags this to wide long on. Protection there
full, on off, and he leans into an elevated drive that covers long off! That brings the RR under nine
ouch! Full, on middle, and drilled straight to Paul. Ball ricochets off his shin, but he shows no pain! Wow
length ball, on middle. He opens the bat's face and drives to extra cover
fullish, on middle, and he opens the bat's face. Drives to backward point, and they manage to pinch a single
full, on middle. And driven off his toes to long on for a single
length ball, on middle, and he's deceived by the slower ball. Tried to ride the bounce and defend but couldn't get any connection
falls in no man's land! Pollard from long on can't get to it. Slower ball again, and Kohli tried to muscle it. Flew off his edge, but couldn't find the fielder
hits the boundary on the full! Kohli makes amends and how. Full outside off, and it's another exquisite drive over the infield. The TV umpire is now deciding whether it's a four or a six
full, on his toes, and drilled to deep midwicket
full, just outside off, and he skips down the ground to drive. Finds the fielder at long off though
length, on middle, and he muscles a shot past the bowler's left to long on
full, just outside off, and that's some elite whippage from Kohli. Places it to the right of long on, and that shot is greeted with applause from both sides
slower ball, wide outside off, and cut square to deep point
full, on middle, and he drives with the bat's open face over extra cover! Smile on the youngster's face after getting a fist-pump from his cap'n
length, on off, and he rocks back deep into his crease before flicking off his pads past deep midwicket. Important boundary to get to his 21st T20I half-century
nudged off his pads to square leg for a single
length ball, on middle, and turning away. Cut square to the man in the deep
length ball outside off, and Kohli's front-foot punch finds mid-off
full, on off. Driven to long on for a single
reverse paddle-sweep! Full, aimed on off stump, and he uses his bat like a broom to sweep it over short third man
guided to deep point for a single
yorker, on leg stump. Tapped to the gap near midwicket for a double
yorker, on leg stump. Flicked to deep backward square
slower ball, full on off, and he drags a shot to deep midwicket
back of a length on off. Ball gets big on Pant, and he mistimes it to midwicket
full, on leg, and flicked over short fine leg! What a shot, epic wristwork
hits the stumps but with no power, and therefore Kohli survives. Looks to dig this away, but the ball trickled onto his stumps
length ball, outside off, and he pulls this square to deep midwicket
dug away, but straight to point! Looks to guide this yorker over the infield, but finds Evin Lewis. A terrific innings comes to a close
just outside off, and driven to mid off for a single
low full toss, on leg stump, and Pant drops his knees before clipping a shot over deep backward square. Elite
full, on middle. Drilled to mid-on for a quick single
full pitched, on middle, and clipped to backward square for a single
full, on middle. Defended to mid-on
full, on leg stump. He comes down the wicket to drive to long on
fullish, wide outside off. Pant is forced to stretch at it. Mistimes to long off
back of a length, outside leg stump, tries to pull but gloves it instead
full, wide outside off, and Pandey can't get to it. Through to the keeper
what a shot to end the series! Full, on middle, and he checks an uppish drive over the bowler's head for six. India win by seven wickets
